intro: Dissochaeta reinwardtiana, commonly known as the African hairvane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Dissochaeta reinwardtiana is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with seasonal rainfall.
